byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and J. David Goodman from New York.

abstract: Syrian National Council, prominent opposition group, calls for international protection for civilians in face of an ongoing crackdown on anti-government protesters; unusual request for international assistance comes a day before the scheduled arrival of an Arab delegation to Syria in an effort to resolve seven months of unrest; council pledges that it will not participate in any such dialogue until the crackdown ends.
snippet: A Syrian opposition group called on Tuesday for international protection from the government’s military crackdown on protesters.

lead_paragraph: A Syrian opposition group called on Tuesday for international protection from the government’s military crackdown on protesters.

headline.main: Syrian Opposition Calls for Protection from Crackdown
headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition Seeks Crackdown Protection as Arab Leaders Push Talks
